flow_model_title: Oil Well to Storage/Distribution Flow Model

nodes.label: Crude Oil Input
nodes.graphic_text: Input point for crude oil into the refinery.
nodes.definition: The crude oil feed entering the refinery.

nodes.label: Distillation Column
nodes.graphic_text: Distillation plant for separating crude oil into chemical fractions.
nodes.definition: Primary separation process for crude oil.

nodes.label: Cracking Unit
nodes.graphic_text: Breaks larger hydrocarbons into smaller molecules.
nodes.definition: Processes heavy fractions into lighter fuels.

nodes.label: Reforming Unit
nodes.graphic_text: Rearranges molecules to increase the octane number.
nodes.definition: Converts naphtha into high-octane fuels.

nodes.label: Blending Unit
nodes.definition: Produces final fuel blends.

nodes.label: Fuel Storage
nodes.definition: Stores the finished fuel products

flows.label: Crude Oil
flows.definition: Flow of crude oil to the distillation column.

flows.label: Heavy Fractions
flows.definition: Heavy fractions flow to the cracking unit.

conversion_formulas.formula: typically: C16H34, C10H8 -&gt; C8H18, C7H8, C6H12
conversion_formulas.description: Cracking of heavy fractions to smaller molecules

flows.label: Cracked Gasoline
flows.definition: Cracked gasoline flows to the reforming unit. Other fuels produced from the distillation/cracking process include: LPG, Kerosene, Diesel and Fuel Oil. Naptha and Bitumen are also produced

flows.label: Reformed Gasoline
flows.definition: Reformed gasoline flows to the blending unit.

pages.title: Oil Well - Drilling and Extraction
pages.keywords: oil well, drilling, extraction, crude oil

nodes.label: Boring Equipment
nodes.definition: Equipment used to bore into the earth for accessing the oil reservoir.

nodes.label: Oil Reservoir
nodes.definition: Underground pool of liquid petroleum contained in porous rock formations.

nodes.label: Pumping Equipment
nodes.definition: Pumps used to extract crude oil from the oil reservoir and transport it to the surface.

flows.label: Drilling Mud
flows.definition: Flow of drilling mud used in the drilling process from boring equipment to the oil reservoir.

flows.label: Rock Slurry
flows.definition: Flow of rock slurry generated during the drilling process from boring equipment to the surface.

flows.label: Crude Oil
flows.definition: Flow of crude oil from the oil reservoir to the pumping equipment at the surface.

pages.title: Boring Components and Process
pages.keywords: boring, drilling, drive, extraction, oil well

nodes.label: Top Drive
nodes.definition: A mechanical device used to rotate the drill string during the boring process.

nodes.label: Drill String
nodes.definition: A series of connected pipes that transmit the rotational force to the drill bit.

nodes.label: Rotary Drill Bit
nodes.definition: A rotating drill bit used to bore through rock layers to access the oil reservoir.
nodes.keywords: drill bit, rotary, boring, oil extraction

nodes.label: Drilling Mud Pump
nodes.definition: A pump used to circulate drilling mud to lubricate the drill bit and carry rock cuttings to the surface.
nodes.keywords: drilling mud, mud pump, lubrication, debris removal

nodes.label: Mud Return System
nodes.graphic_text: Device for separating drilling mud from rock debris, also known as a shale shaker.
nodes.definition: A system that recovers the drilling mud and separates it from rock cuttings.

flows.label: Rotational Force
flows.definition: Flow of rotational force from the Top Drive to the Drill String.

flows.label: Rotational Force
flows.definition: Flow of rotational force from the Top Drive to the Drill String.

flows.label: Drilling Mud
flows.definition: Flow of drilling mud from the Drilling Mud Pump to the Rotary Drill Bit.

flows.label: Drilling Mud
flows.definition: Flow of drilling mud from the Drilling Mud Pump to the Rotary Drill Bit.

flows.label: Drilling Mud
flows.definition: Flow of drilling mud from Mud Return system to Mud Pump.

flows.label: Rock Debris
flows.definition: Flow of rock debris and slurry from the boring process.

nodes.label: Crude Oil Input
nodes.graphic_text: Input point for crude oil into the refinery.
nodes.definition: The crude oil feed entering the refinery.

nodes.graphic_text: Distillation plant for separating crude oil into chemical fractions.

nodes.graphic_text: Breaks larger hydrocarbons into smaller molecules.
nodes.definition: Processes heavy fractions into lighter fuels.

nodes.label: Reforming Unit
nodes.graphic_text: Rearranges molecules to increase the octane number.
nodes.definition: Converts naphtha into high-octane fuels.

nodes.label: Blending Unit
nodes.definition: Produces final fuel blends.

nodes.label: Fuel Storage
nodes.definition: Stores the finished fuel products

flows.definition: Flow of crude oil to the distillation column.

flows.label: Heavy Fractions
flows.definition: Heavy fractions flow to the cracking unit.

conversion_formulas.description: Cracking of heavy fractions to smaller molecules

flows.label: Cracked Gasoline
flows.definition: Cracked gasoline flows to the reforming unit. Other fuels produced from the distillation/cracking process include: LPG, Kerosene, Diesel and Fuel Oil. Naptha and Bitumen are also produced
